content.description: An eliminate/ variation linking "Final Fantasy" into "Lord of the Flies". Sit start as for "Final Fantasy" and make a long reach out left to a good horizontal edge that can also be used as a sidepull. The feet are good and you have to rock over the left toe and lunge for it while staying close to the wall. I hit the edge with two fingers. After snagging the good hold, hold the tension and move your feet in order to match. From here move up to two good crimps. Set the feet and make a jump move to a good shelf protruding from the face. This shelf has a small tree growing on it. From the shelf match and head direct on good holds to a fun topout. It gets kind of high off the deck, but the landing is decent, especially by Clough standards.    A very fun variation to do while warming up on this great boulder.
content.protection: 2 or 3 pads and a spotter. The landing is fairly flat.
content.location: Located on the Island Boulder across the road from the main parking lot. From the lot look across the road and you will see a clearing, enter the clearing and head to the back right where there is an old trail and a stone wall. Follow the rock wall and walk for a minute or so, this boulder will be around a short hillside and will be the biggest boulder around.

content.description:
The tallest line on this bloc that heads straight up the overhang.  

  Start the same as for Lord Of The Flies, and makes the same first couple moves, but instead of making a big move out left this heads up to the left side of the ledge with the little tree. From here it continues straight up the face using another great edge and tops out at the very peak of the overhang.
content.location: On the overhang across the road from the parking lot.

content.description: Sit start at a high right hand crimp and a decent left hand hold. There are different options for foothold, although pulling off the ground is hard and committing. Reach up to a good edge and move left to more edges and then launch up to a big sloper shelf or a crimp rail slightly lower. Continue climbing up and right avoiding the tree and then top out.
content.location: Located on The Island Boulder, which is across the street from The Clough State Park parking lot. Follow a seldomly used trail until you see a dirrbikw prohibited sign, then veer left along a rock wall until you see a big rock face on the left.

content.description:
This line traverses The Island Boulder from the start of "Final Fantasy" all the way left to top out the left arete. There are a lot of holds on this boulder making it a great warm up spot, and it is also 2 minutes from parking. Sit start and choose your choice of edges and crimps to make your way leftward to the other side of the boulder. Head up to a giant sloper shelf on the left arete or use good crimps instead to top out. 

  This boulder is almost like a gym wall. There are so many options, so I figured I'd add a few variations that have been done. This is definitely the spot to go before heading across the bridge/ spillway.
content.location: Approach as for "The Most Dangerous Game".

content.description: An awesome problem with big fun moves and good holds. Sit start with the left hand on a finger jug or a side pull ear slightly lower. Right hand on a left facing jug. Pull on and reach over with the left hand to a jug, then reach right hand to another good hold. From here climb up then make a big move left to an edge. Bring the right hand over and prep yourself for a big dead point move to a small crimp, or a big hold 6 inches higher. From here pull up and grab the arete and stand up on to the slab to top out.
content.location: On The Island Boulder. This climb starts slightly right of center on the giant diagnol crack and flake system.

content.description: Sit start as for "Final Fantasy" but after the first few moves continue up and right to a big shelf, then finish direct and pull on to the slab to top out.
content.location: The Island Boulder. Slightly right of center.

content.description:
A tall proud boulder with some good quality problems about three to five minutes from the main parking lot.   This block has a variety of holds, and a flat landing making it a great warm up or training destination for locals.  

  This boulder is about 15 feet tall at its apex.
